alert.note: Alert for Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 3:22AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of New Hanover, southeastern Pender and east central Brunswick Counties through 400 AM EDT... At 322 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hightsville, or near Wilmington, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Leland, Wrightsville Beach, North Masonboro Island, Figure Eight Island, Hampstead, Topsail Beach, Bishop, Hightsville, Cape Fear Community College North Campus, Wilmington International Airport, Murrayville, Masonboro, University Of North Carolina At Wilmington, Scotts Hill, Ogden, Winnabow, Mayfaire, Wrightsboro and Town Creek. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 414 and 416. Interstate 140 between mile markers 15 and 20. US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 34 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender
